Material used.Description: ESI - MS in the positive mode was used to determine whether glycine forms a ternary complex with Cu(II)-R - synuclein (A53T). Pure A53T solution or A53T mixed with Cu(II)-Gly complex [Cu(II):Gly molar ratio as 1:4] was injected at a rate of 3 µL/min. The peptide was mixed with Cu(Gly)₂ solution in NH₄HCO₃ buffer (8 mM, pH 7.2) immediately before injection for quantification by ESI - MS.

Readout description.Conclusion: No ternary Gly - Cu(II)-A53T complex was present in solution
Readout description.Result Description: The m/z values of the peaks observed for the sample of A53T exposed to Cu(II)-Gly complex correspond to those expected for the 1:1 Cu(II):A53T complex; no peaks are observed in the MS data that would correspond to the ternary Gly - Cu(II)-A53T complex

Material used.Material Name: WT, A30P, and A53T R - synuclein
Material used.Description: The titrations were conducted in PIPES buffer. The reaction cell contained ∼70 - 90 µM R - synuclein solution in PIPES buffer. The copper solution, the titrant, was made from the stock copper solution to a concentration such that the molar ratio of Cu(II) to R - synuclein at the end of the titration was ∼2.

Readout description.Conclusion: WT and A53T bind to Cu(II) similarly with a binding stoichiometry of ∼0.8. A30P shows two types of Cu(II) binding
Readout description.Molecular Effect: For A30P, the major binding site has a binding constant slightly lower (∼30%) than WT and A53T, and a minor but strong binding site is attributed to binding to small oligomeric species
Readout description.Result Description: For WT and A53T, the pH - dependent binding affinity constants (K) and heats (H) were K ∼ 2.4 × 10⁹ M⁻¹ and H ∼ - 1.1 kcal/mol at pH 7.2 and K ∼ 4.8 × 10⁹ M⁻¹ and H ∼ - 1.8 kcal/mol at pH 7.4. For A30P, the major binding site (90% of total Cu(II) bound) has a binding constant ∼10⁹ M⁻¹, and the minor site (10%) has a larger binding constant ∼10¹⁰ M⁻¹

Biological replicates.Description: Two runs for each condition were performed

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Nonlinear least - squares fit to determine binding parameters

Experiment Method.Assay Method: Thioflavin - T (ThT) Fluorescence Assay for Fibril Formation

Material used.Material Name: WT, A30P, and A53T R - synuclein
Material used.Description: An aliquot of 5 µL of peptide (∼70 µM) solution was mixed with 1 mL of 10 µM ThT in PIPES.

Readout description.Conclusion: No fibrils were formed due to Cu(II) binding under the experimental conditions
Readout description.Result Description: The ThT fluorescence intensities in the presence of WT, A53T, and A30P R - synuclein solutions both before and after ITC titration were of the same level as ThT solution alone

Material used.Material Name: WT, A30P, and A53T R - synuclein
Material used.Description: The aggregation status of R - synuclein protein after being stored for more than 6 months at - 20 °C was examined with SEC, performed using the prepacked ZORBAX GF - 250 size exclusion column. Phosphate buffer (20 mM, pH 7.4, and an ionic strength of 160 mM as adjusted by NaCl) was used as the mobile phase, with a flow rate at 0.3 mL/min. An aliquot of 5 µL of ∼100 µM R - synuclein solution was loaded and monitored by UV absorption at 280 nm.

Readout description.Conclusion: A considerable amount of small aggregates was formed for solutions of WT and A53T but not for A30P
Readout description.Result Description: SEC showed that small aggregates were present in WT and A53T solutions, while A30P was still dominantly in the monomeric form and/or intermediates
